intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. telonense, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. This variety is closely related to other members of the Apiaceae family, sharing similar structural and chemical characteristics.
